Groups.Title: Create Pages
Groups.Description: Examples of how to use the HTTP POST verb to create pages with different types of content

Items.Title: Simple page using HTML
Items.Description: Create a simple page using HTML to describe the page content

Items.Title: Page with an image
Items.Description: Create a page with some formatted text and an image

Items.Title: Page with a snapshot of an embedded web page
Items.Description: Create a page with a snapshot of the HTML of a web page on it

Items.Title: Page with a snapshot of a url
Items.Description: Create a page with a snapshot of the OneNote.com homepage on it.

Items.Title: Page with a PDF attachment rendered
Items.Description: Create a page with a PDF file attachment rendered

Items.Title: Page with note tags
Items.Description: Create a page with examples of note tags. For example build a to do list

Items.Title: Page with a business card
Items.Description: Create a page with a business card info automatically extracted from an image

Items.Title: Page with a recipe
Items.Description: Create a page with a cooking recipe automatically extracted from an example webpage

Items.Title: Page with product info
Items.Description: Create a page with a product info automatically extracted from an example amazon.com webpage

Items.Title: Page under a named section
Items.Description: Create a page under a given section name using the 'sectionName' query parameter. Please enter a section name in the TextBox below. If the named section does not exist, it will be auto-created

Items.Title: Page under a specific notebook and section
Items.Description: Create a page under a specific notebook and section. First we will make a call to fetch all the user's notebooks and sections and then create a page under one of the selected notebook and section. Please select a specific notebook and section in the drop-down below.

Groups.Title: Query and Search Pages
Groups.Description: Examples of how to use the HTTP GET verb to query and search for pages and their contents using the OneNote API

Items.Title: List of all pages
Items.Description: Queries for all pages in OneNote and returns a paginated list. By default, paging returns the first 20 pages ordered by created time descending (default sort order). The @odata.nextLink in the Response or $skip and $top query parameters can be used to retrieve the next set of pages

Items.Title: Metadata of a specific page
Items.Description: Following the previous example, first we get a paginated list of all pages and then query the metadata for one of the selected pages. Please select a specific page from the drop-down below

Items.Title: Pages with a specific title
Items.Description: Query for a paginated list of pages that contain a given title substring. This example shows how to use the $filter=contains(title, '<term>') query parameter. Please enter a case-sensitive title substring in the TextBox below.

Items.Title: Pages query with $skip and $top params
Items.Description: Since the list of pages returned is paginated, this example shows how to use the $skip=20&$top=3 query parameters to get up to 3 additional pages after the first 20 pages

Items.Title: Sorted list of pages with selected metadata
Items.Description: Get a sorted list of pages using the $orderBy=title asc query parameter and only specific metadata in the response using the $select=id,title query parameter. $orderBy can be used to specify your custom sort order

Items.Title: Search all pages
Items.Description: Search all pages and return the paginated list of matching pages that contain the given search term (case-insensitive search)

Items.Title: Recall a page's content as HTML
Items.Description: First we get a paginated list of all pages and then return back the content of one of the selected pages as HTML

Groups.Title: Manage Notebooks and Sections
Groups.Description: Examples of how to use the HTTP GET and POST verbs to manage notebooks and sections using the OneNote API

Items.Title: Get Notebooks and Sections using $expand
Items.Description: This is one example to demonstrate how the $expand query parameter can be used to return all notebooks and their descendant sections, sectionGroups in one roundtrip. In this case we are going to make a GET request on ~/notebooks?$expand=sections,sectionGroups($expand=sections)

Items.Title: List of all Notebooks
Items.Description: Queries for all notebooks in OneNote and returns a list

Items.Title: Metadata of a specific notebook
Items.Description: Following the previous example, first we get a list of all notebooks and then query the metadata for one of the selected notebooks. Please select a specific notebook from the drop-down below

Items.Title: List of all Sections
Items.Description: Queries for all sections under all notebooks in OneNote and returns a list

Items.Title: Metadata of a specific section
Items.Description: Following the previous example, first we get a list of all sections and then query the metadata for one of the selected sections. Please select a specific section from the drop-down below

Items.Title: List of all SectionGroups
Items.Description: Queries for all sectionGroups under all notebooks in OneNote and returns a list. SectionGroups are not very common, so you may see 0 results

Items.Title: Notebooks with a specific name
Items.Description: Query for a list of all notebooks with a given name. This example shows how to use the '$filter=name eq '<term>' query parameter. Please enter the case-sensitive full notebook name to look for in the TextBox below

Items.Title: Notebooks shared by others
Items.Description: Query for a list of all notebooks where the current user is not an Owner (i.e. the notebooks are owned by someone else and were shared with the current user with either a Reader or Contributor access level). This example shows how to use the '$filter=userRole ne Microsoft.OneNote.Api.UserRole'Owner'' query parameter and will return non-zero results only if the current user has access to shared notebooks

Items.Title: Sorted list of notebooks with selected metadata
Items.Description: Get a sorted list of notebooks using the $orderBy=name asc query parameter and only specific metadata in the response using the $select=id,name query parameter. $orderBy can be used to specify your custom sort order

Items.Title: List of all Sections under a specific notebook
Items.Description: First we get a list of all notebooks and then query for a list of all sections under one of the selected notebooks. Please select a specific notebook from the drop-down below

Items.Title: Sections with a specific name
Items.Description: Query for a list of all sections with a given name. This example shows how to use the '$filter=name eq '<term>' query parameter. Please enter the case-sensitive full section name to look for in the TextBox below

Items.Title: Create a new notebook
Items.Description: Create a new blank notebook. Please enter the new notebook's name in the TextBox below

Items.Title: Create a new section
Items.Description: First we get a list of all notebooks and then create a new blank section under one of the selected notebooks. Please select a specific notebook from the drop-down below and also enter the new section's name in the TextBox below

Groups.Title: Update Pages
Groups.Description: Coming soon: Examples of how to use the HTTP PATCH verb to update the contents of a specific page
